title: 109_hr4844
content: The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires voters to provide photo identification. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates voters to present photo identification when receiving a ballot. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals to show a government-issued photo ID to vote in person for Federal office elections, with limited exceptions. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates individuals to present a government-issued photo ID to vote in Federal elections, with proof of US citizenship required for the ID. If ID is not provided, the individual can use a provisional ballot. If an individual does not have the required identification, they can cast a provisional ballot for the election but must present the necessary ID within 48 hours to be eligible to vote. The appropriate State or local election official must receive identification from individuals voting other than in person within 48 hours of casting a provisional ballot for a Federal election. The individual must submit a government-issued, current, and valid photo identification when casting a provisional ballot for a Federal election in person. The individual must provide proof of United States citizenship for identification, except for overseas military voters on active duty. The term 'absent uniformed services voter' is defined in the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act. Specific requirements for identifications include being government-issued by the Federal Government or a State. The identification must be government-issued by the Federal Government or a State and require proof of United States citizenship for issuance. Amendments to the Act include changing the heading to focus on providing photo identification. Amendments to section 15483 focus on providing photo identification for voters. The table of contents of the Act is also amended to reflect this change. Section 303 of the Act requires computerized statewide voter registration lists and photo identification for elections starting in November 2008. The amendment (42 U.S.C. 15483(d)(2)) now requires photo identification for federal elections starting in November 2008 and subsequent elections. The amendment now requires photo identification for federal elections starting in November 2008 and subsequent elections. Making photo identifications available. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment now mandates states to provide photo identifications for federal elections starting in November 2008 and subsequent elections. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment requires states to offer photo identifications for federal elections starting in November 2008. The program allows individuals without government-issued photo IDs to obtain one for voting purposes, with no cost for indigent individuals. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment requires states to offer photo identifications for federal elections starting in November 2008. The program allows individuals without government-issued photo IDs to obtain one for voting purposes, with no cost for indigent individuals. The fee charged for the identification must not exceed the reasonable cost to the State, and individuals unable to afford the fee can provide an attestation to waive the cost. The photo identification provided under the program cannot be used for other purposes. The program established for providing government-issued photo identification for voting purposes cannot be used for any other State or local government functions. Payments will be made to cover the costs of providing photo identifications for voting to indigent individuals. The Commission will make payments to States to cover costs for providing photo identifications to individuals unable to afford fees under the program. The payment amount to a State will equal the fees that would have been collected but for certain provisions, based on information provided by the State. The Commission will make payments to States for providing photo identifications to individuals unable to afford fees, based on information provided by the State. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part for fiscal year 2008 and each succeeding fiscal year. Payments to cover costs of providing photo identifications for voting to indigent individuals. Sec. 297A. Authorization of appropriations. Effective Date: October 1, 2007.
